ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I furthered my knowledge on the Indonesian language and on Indonesian culture. I loved taking Indonesian again this semester.

From this course, I feel that I have a greater ability to read Indonesian news as well as to engage topics ranging from weather, to current events, to arguments. I feel that I also learned a bit more on how to debate and to properly prepare formal writing in Bahasa Indonesian.
In this class we talked a lot in Indonesian and learned more about the culture, like music.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class is great! I honestly can't think of anything that needs to be improved.

The course is great in introducing students to advanced Indonesian language usage, specifically in the context of expressing opinions, arguments, and formal writing. I do think improvements could be made in having a syllabus that outlined the timeline of the course as well as what textbooks could be supplemental for students. At times, I felt that there was no where to find such supplements, leaving students to feel very on their own in terms of learning the language. Thought the professor is always a wonderful resource, I would like to have had a textbook for the course.
It was slightly disorganized because we had a different person from Indonesia teaching many of the classes and it was unclear when assignments were due and to whom we should hand them in to.
Strengths: Improved our grammar, reading and writing skills Weakness: Organization of class could be improved.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, Pak is an amazing professor, and I learned a lot this semester!

As this is an Advanced Indonesian course, I would only recommend it to the student who is willing to put in a lot of effort for the self-discipline required to succeed in this course. All too often, students rely on the internet to learn the language. For a student to truly succeed, a genuine desire to learn as well as the extra effort can make this course all the while better for anyone who wants to see improvement in the language.
I would recommend this class because I love Indo and the professors are great. The people in the class are nice and the atmosphere is fun.
If someone wants to further learn the Indonesian language, take it.
